sources.title: They had to See Paris (1929) WILL ROGERSüçï COMEDY
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Will Rogers, Irene Rich, Marguerite Churchill, Fifi D'Orsay
Director: Frank Borzage

Step back in time with this pre-Code gem from Fox Film Corp, directed by Frank Borzage‚Äîan Oscar-winning filmmaker known for his heartfelt storytelling. The beloved Will Rogers stars as an American mechanic turned oilman who reluctantly journeys to Paris with his family, leading to culture clashes, social satire, and unforgettable moments abroad.

 Already a beloved humorist and vaudeville star, Rogers brought his signature wit and plainspoken charm to the screen just as Hollywood transitioned to sound. 

Co-starring Irene Rich and Owen Davis Jr., the film offers a humorous yet revealing look at American values abroad during the Jazz Age. Margaret Lawrence and Fifi D'Orsay round out the stellar cast, bringing charm and continental flair to this sharp, character-driven narrative.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üé≠ Subscribe for more Oscar-winning films, vintage musicals, and Pre-Code Hollywood gems!

sources.title: They Had To See Paris (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. This globe-trotting comedy is the talkie debut of star Will Rogers, as well as the first film ever for Fifi D'Orsay. The Film was successful enough to warrant a sequel in 1932, although with a very different tone, as the depression was in full swing at that point.¬†

metadata.Plot: Oklahoma mechanic Pike Peters finds himself part owner of an oil field. His wife Idy, hitherto content, decides the family must go to Paris to get "culture" and meet "the right kind of people." Pike and his grown son and daughter soon have flirtatious French admirers; Idy rents a chateau from an impoverished aristocrat; while Pike responds to each new development with homespun wit. In the inevitable clash, will pretentiousness and sophistication or common sense triumph?
metadata.Writer: Owen Davis, Homer Croy, Sonya Levien
metadata.Actors: Will Rogers, Irene Rich, Owen Davis Jr.
